definitions.definition: go or come up (a slope, incline, or staircase), especially by using the feet and sometimes the hands; ascend.
examples: we began to climb the hill

definitions.definition: (of an aircraft or the sun) go upward.
examples: we decided to climb to 6,000 feet

definitions.definition: (of a road or track) slope upward or up.
examples: the track climbed steeply up a narrow, twisting valley

definitions.definition: (of a plant) grow up (a wall, tree, or trellis) by clinging with tendrils or by twining.
examples: when ivy climbs a wall, it infiltrates any crack

definitions.definition: grow in scale, value, or power.
move to a higher position in (a chart or table).
examples: the song is climbing the adult-contemporary chart
synonyms: work one's way (up) "he climbed through the ranks"

definitions.definition: move with effort, especially into or out of a confined space; clamber.
examples: Howard started to climb out of the front seat
synonyms: scramble; step "he climbed out of his car"
